item.title: [DISTRELEC-4509] Reduce distance from hero teaser to header on home page
item.description:
The home page allows for

  • a H1
  • a hero teaser with or without headline
  • a carpet and further content components

For the H1 a distance from the header is defined. The hero teaser follows below.
If the H1 is empty, the hero teaser should move up a bit, and the distance from the header to the hero teaser should be the same as from the header to the H1.
item.summary: Reduce distance from hero teaser to header on home page

comments.comment: Fix added. can be tested after next deployment.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4503] Activate WS410 hybris service
item.description:
The Vivocha appilcation is using the Hybris Webservice API to access on Hybris back-end.

Since the WS410 has been deactivated. We need to activate it to use all vivocha features.

The resources the integration will try to access (read-only) are:

  • /ws410/rest/customers/
  • /ws410/rest/orders/
  • /ws410/rest/carts/
  • /ws410/rest/customersegmentvivochacomponents/

Please refer to:

  • https://wiki.hybris.com/display/release4/WebService+API+-+Reference
  • https://wiki.hybris.com/display/release4/platformwebservices+Extension+-+Technical+Guide

Note: the vivocha service is hosted on Amazon Cloud

comments.comment:
We cannot use IP range because the servers of Vivocha are in the Amazon cloud with auto scaling enabled.

Regarding Vivocha usually nobody is concerned about giving public access to the REST API.
We need a verified user to make API requests and our username and password credentials should be stored on their db servers.

Hi Nabil
I changed apache configuration to allow access to /ws410 - but for HTTPS only.
To access the webservice a created a distinct user: Please tell Vivocha guys to use the follwing credentials: User=technicalUserVivocha / Pass=hZZ4kyy8
If you want to test yourself, you may use a RESTclient like https://github.com/wiztools/rest-client

Cheers, Adi

Hi Adrian,

I noticed that you changed the apache configurations on HP-Q, however, we need this to be changed on HP-P as well. Could you do that please.
Apache setup for HP-P will be done by the post-installation steps.

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4494] Postal code validation in registration forms
item.description:
We currently validate the postal code (ZIP) for LT only.
Since SAP validates the ZIP more restrictive, a registration might turn into an error (SAP returns an error "ZIP code must have a length of 5" and the shop displays a general error). see DISTRELEC-4381

Setup validation for ALL countries with the following RegExp rule:

AT - e.g. 1200:    ^[0-9]{4}$
CH - e.g. 9001:    ^[0-9]{4}$
DE - e.g. 88131:   ^[0-9]{5}$
DK - e.g. 2791:    ^[0-9]{4}$
EE - e.g. 66601:   ^[0-9]{5}$
EX - max 8 chars:  ^.{0,8}$     (e.g. Japan 222-8525)
FI - e.g. 22100:   ^[0-9]{5}$
IT - e.g. 20020:   ^[0-9]{5}$
LT - e.g. 36224:   ^[0-9]{5}$
LV - e.g. 1006:    ^[0-9]{4}$
NL - e.g. 5737 ZG: ^[0-9]{4} [A-Z]{2}$
NO - e.g. 4611:    ^[0-9]{4}$
PL - e.g. 62-020:  ^[0-9]{2}-[0-9]{3}$
SE - e.g. 45155 :  ^[0-9]{5}$

The rules have beed defined regarding information from Gazwan and the following Wiki page http://de.wikipedia.org/wiki/Liste_der_Postleitsysteme.

Testing tool: http://regex101.com/
item.summary: Postal code validation in registration forms

comments.comment: Feedback from Gazwan: I just noticed that Japan has 8-digit postal code "222-8525" and we have them as a customer today in SAP.

@Florian: I finished the task since I have already started. Can you please perform/organize an IN-DEPTH testing with ALL countries and ALL languages available in EACH country. This is necessary since validation pattern has to be defined for each lang/country pattern (e.g. en_NL).

item.title: [DISTRELEC-4210] Opt-in confirmation email is old-version
item.description: The opt-in confirmation email template is the old one. The one we use for all new Distrelec platforms is the one with the football field.

comments.comment: Angel please let me know on which web shop you are testing.
test.distrelec.lt

The new templates have not been copied from the prod down to the test environment.
Angel, is it also wrong on the live system?
It is still the old template in the live System. I included a screenshot for you to see.
This email is sent by optivo directly or by hybris?

It is sent by Hybris.

We want to Change to Optivo in the near future but that depends on Florian when it gets approved and we move it Forward.

Angel,

The registration email is sent by hybris this is true. However, the template in the screenshot is related to the newsletter subscription and it is sent by Optivo directly.

The template has been fixed in Optivo.

http://lt.elfadistrelec.com/ov?mailing=10TSM4VT-K8J1EDD&m2u=10TSM4VW-10TSM4VT-JOL1D01&utm_medium=email&rid=YS3YHO6-RPGEGJ

item.title: [DISTRELEC-3570] Add to basket (extended)
item.description:
Could you please extend our add to basket URL (www.distrelec.ch/cart/ext-add?productCode=102010&qty=4) to add more then one item to the cart?

for example:
http://www.distrelec.ch/cart/ext-add?productCode_1=10010&qty_1=4&productCode_2=112111&qty_2=5&

comments.comment: gemäss Besprechung

Hi,

You could add to basket URL in various ways as follows:

http://distrelec-ch.local:9001/cart/ext-add?productCode=117862&qty=4&productCode=117863&qty=3
http://distrelec-ch.local:9001/cart/ext-add?productCode=117862&productCode=117863&qty=3
http://distrelec-ch.local:9001/cart/ext-add?productCode=117862,117863&qty=3
http://distrelec-ch.local:9001/cart/ext-add?productCode=117862,117863
http://distrelec-ch.local:9001/cart/ext-add?productCode=117862&productCode=117863&productCode=117864&qty=3
http://distrelec-ch.local:9001/cart/ext-add?productCode=117862&productCode=117863&productCode=117864
Fixed
